on reading compounds: 託す【タクス】to entrust (someone) with, to leave (a matter) with someone, to place under someone's care, to have someone deliver (a message, parcel, etc.), to send (through someone), to leave (a message) with someone, to use (something) to express (one's feelings, opinion, etc.), to express in the form of (something), to use as a pretext
托鉢【タクハツ】monk's "begging", religious mendicancy, asking for alms, going with one's bowl to the meditation hall at mealtime (in a Zen temple)
屈託【クッタク】worry, care, concern, ennui, boredom
kun reading compounds: 託する【たくする】to entrust (someone) with, to leave (a matter) with someone, to place under someone's care, to have someone deliver (a message, parcel, etc.), to send (through someone), to leave (a message) with someone, to use (something) to express (one's feelings, opinion, etc.), to express in the form of (something), to use as a pretext
